title: Teaching without certificates or licenses;
context: §302A-603 Teaching without certificates or licenses; penalty. (a) Except as otherwise provided, before the 1997-1998 school year, whoever serves in the department as a teacher without holding an unrevoked certificate issued under sections 302A-602 to 302A-639, and 302A-701, shall be fined not more than $25. (b) Beginning with the 1997-1998 school year, whoever serves in the department as a teacher, paid under the salary schedule contained in the unit 5 collective bargaining agreement, without holding an unrevoked or unsuspended license or credential issued under sections 302A-801 to 302A-808, shall be fined not more than $500. &copy; Beginning with the 2002-2003 school year, an individual paid under the salary schedule contained in the unit 5 collective bargaining agreement, without holding an unrevoked license issued under sections 302A-801 to 302A-808, shall be fined not more than $500. (d) Beginning with the 2002-2003 school year, emergency hires shall not be subject to this penalty. [L 1996, c 89, pt of §2 and am c 122, §§3, 7; am L 1999, c 218, §4; am L 2001, c 312, §§6, 11; am L 2002, c 193, §3; am L 2012, c 133, §10]
